Deadpool

Deadpool (2016)

Add Article
  • All Critics
  •  | 
  • Top Critics

TOMATOMETER

84%
Average Rating: 7/10
Reviews Counted: 323
Fresh: 271
Rotten: 52

Critics Consensus: Fast, funny, and gleefully profane, the fourth-wall-busting Deadpool subverts superhero film formula with wildly entertaining -- and decidedly non-family-friendly -- results.

71%
Average Rating: 6.5/10
Reviews Counted: 45
Fresh: 32
Rotten: 13

Critics Consensus: Fast, funny, and gleefully profane, the fourth-wall-busting Deadpool subverts superhero film formula with wildly entertaining -- and decidedly non-family-friendly -- results.

Critic Consensus: Fast, funny, and gleefully profane, the fourth-wall-busting Deadpool subverts superhero film formula with wildly entertaining -- and decidedly non-family-friendly -- results.

Deadpool Photos

Movie Info

Based upon Marvel Comics' most unconventional anti-hero, DEADPOOL tells the origin story of former Special Forces operative turned mercenary Wade Wilson, who after being subjected to a rogue experiment that leaves him with accelerated healing powers, adopts the alter ego Deadpool. Armed with his new abilities and a dark, twisted sense of humor, Deadpool hunts down the man who nearly destroyed his life. (C) Fox
  • Rating:
    R (for strong violence and language throughout, sexual content and graphic nudity)
  • Genre:
    Action & Adventure, Comedy, Science Fiction & Fantasy
  • Directed By:
    Tim Miller
  • Written By:
    Rhett Reese, Paul Wernick
  • In Theaters:
    Feb 12, 2016  wide
  • On Disc/Streaming:
    May 10, 2016
  • Box Office:
    $328,674,489
  • Runtime:
    103 minutes
  • Studio:
    20th Century Fox

Critic Reviews for Deadpool

All Critics (323) | Top Critics (45) | Fresh (271) | Rotten (52) | DVD (1)

Watching the film is like sitting at dinner with a teen-ager who believes that, if he swears long and loudly enough, he will shock the grownups into accepting him as one of their own.

Feb 15, 2016 | Full Review…
Anthony Lane
New Yorker
Top Critic

Flamboyantly vulgar and determinedly self-referential, Deadpool has the shape of a superhero movie but the soul of a Danny McBride flick.

Feb 15, 2016 | Full Review…
Christopher Orr
The Atlantic
Top Critic

Deadpool is obnoxious and puerile and infantile and has an irritating meta tone so snide that it's constantly in danger of nullifying the entire movie -- and I still got a pretty big kick out of it.

Feb 12, 2016 | Rating: B | Full Review…
Will Leitch
The New Republic
Top Critic

It's fun for a while, and then it all becomes deeply disheartening, because calling attention to the more businesslike mechanics of superheroics isn't subversive when you're also playing right into them.

Feb 12, 2016 | Full Review…
Alison Willmore
BuzzFeed News
Top Critic

It seems less irreverent than self-congratulatory.

Feb 12, 2016 | Rating: C+ | Full Review…
Peter Rainer
Christian Science Monitor
Top Critic

Deadpool is everything that Hollywood has raised audiences to believe heroes are not: crass, selfish and with a vocabulary that would have made George Carlin blush.

Feb 12, 2016 | Rating: 3/4 | Full Review…
Barry Hertz
Globe and Mail
Top Critic

What makes Deadpool a very, very special member of the Marvel Universe is that he rides that Bugs Bunny plane of existence where he has a direct, ongoing conversation with us, the audience.

Feb 22, 2019 | Rating: 7/10 | Full Review…
Bernard Boo
Way Too Indie

This movie is funny. Like, REALLY funny. In fact, I'd call it the funniest big-budget superhero movie that we've seen.

Feb 20, 2019 | Rating: 5/5 | Full Review…
Allen Adams
The Maine Edge

He [Ryan Reynolds] has created a character that is charming, funny, snarky and uncouth with an edge of smugness, yet thanks to the dynamic charisma of both actor and character you are immediately drawn to him despite his faults.

Feb 15, 2019 | Rating: 4/5 | Full Review…
Paula Fleri-Soler
Times of Malta

The best elements center around Reynolds and Baccarin, who both do great work in this one.

Feb 4, 2019 | Full Review…
Amanda Greever
The Daily Times (Tennessee)

Deadpool as a character is big and loud and borderline obnoxious so the movie around him does a great job of being small and focused, letting him steal the show.

Jan 26, 2019 | Full Review…
Ed Travis
Cinapse

It is a nice change of pace that brings plenty of laughs and a bit of originality to the Marvel universe.

Jan 15, 2019 | Rating: B+ | Full Review…
Micheal Compton
Bowling Green Daily News
View All Critic Reviews (323)

Audience Reviews for Deadpool

½

Deadpool is the most asinine superhero ever. His character is insufferable, and the story structure is clunky. Sound, costumes and acting are better than usual, but I don't understand why anyone would claim to have enjoyed watching this bipolar fantasy.

Christian C

Super Reviewer

½

Some jokes were good, but most of them were juvenile sex jokes on the order of "That's what she said", and most unforgivably--two of them were well-known old chestnuts, the one about the brown pants and the Thanksgiving and Christmas legs. Solid, fairly creative action scenes but at times too gory for me, especially with Wade Wilson's vulnerable skin disfigurement. The boyfriend coaxed me to watch this on the plane, and I'm just glad I didn't pay to see this.

Letitia Lew

Super Reviewer

Okay for what it was. I don't really like this type of movie.

Nicki Marie

Super Reviewer

½

Foul and fun as all hell. Reynolds is indeed God's Perfect Idiot as the anarchic, motor-mouthed regular-guy-turned-disfigured-vigilante-crimefighter.

Alice Shen

Super Reviewer

View All

Deadpool Quotes


Wade Wilson/Deadpool: Shit!
Wade Wilson/Deadpool: Daddy Needs To Express Some Rage.
Wade Wilson/Deadpool: Fuck Liefeld!
Wade Wilson/Deadpool: Here's what I'm actually gonna do. I'm gonna work through his crew until somebody gives up Francis, force him to fix this, then put a bullet in his skull and fuck the brain hole!
Weasel: I don't want to see that or think of it again.
